instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2567: What is 820-2567? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2567</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hi iv got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2567</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A it’s not  detecting the ddr3 iv tried a working but still the same story. It’s clean board 

any advise please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2567</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Do you get RAM beeps error?
Inspect RAM solders near the slot corner.
Try one module at a time, every slot separated.
Use DDR3 test card, if possible; see if all LEDs light.

Finally, put good flux and reflow MCP.
You may have luck and is only crap under it.
Heating MCP can also show an internal problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2567</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Cheers man I will check that
